data.title: Memories of Charlton Heston's visit to Bolton
data.meta_description: CHARLTON Heston, who won the 1959 best actor Oscar as the chariot-racing Ben-Hur, and portrayed Moses, Michelangelo, El Cid in Hollywood epics ofâ€¦
data.text:
A spokesman for the Heston family said he died on Saturday at his home in Beverly Hills, California.

His wife, Lydia, was at his side.

Heston wowed the Bolton public in 1987 when he was in town to officially open the new Reebok international headquarters.

At a reception at Bolton Town Hall, Heston told the audience: "I am glad to be part of this day for Bolton and for Reebok which had done so much work for American tennis." One man who remembers meeting the Hollywood legend is former security guard, John Turner.

Mr Turner, aged 58, of Leigh Road, Leigh, was the star's bodyguard for the day. He said: "He is one of my favourite Hollywood actors and I had an absolutely amazing day. He was a really nice chap."

Celebrity chef Tom Bridge, who lives in Blackrod, created a huge ice sculpture for the visit.

He said: "He was a very nice man, a real gentleman. I was very sad to hear of his death."
